results.title: Swedish peasant paintings
results.brief_description: A study of the “gourd” paintings done by the itinerant peasant artists who flourished in the Dalecarlia district of Sweden in the eighteenth century. The scenes usually have a religious content, although floral motifs are frequently used. The diea of the gourd as the symbol of life is taken from the Book of Jonah and recurs throughout these domestic paintings.

results.title: Swedish cinema classics
results.creator_credit: Gardar Sahlberg, Svensk Filmindustri and Swedish Institute
results.brief_description: The great period of Swedish silent cinema - the epoch of Victor Sjostrom and Mauritz Stiller - is remembered in a series of commented sequences from their original works.

results.title: Sweden is horrible
results.creator_credit: Karsten Wedel, Radio Sweden and Wedel Films
results.brief_description: Swedish “sin” is better known throughout the world than Swedish steel, to judge by the interest shown by many foreign publications. This film will either help to confirm preconceived notions on this subject or, perhaps, give you ideas about greater sexual equality.

results.title: Swan song = Jue xiang
results.creator_credit: Zhang Zeming and Pearl River Film Studio
results.brief_description: A simple, moving, and allegorical story of an ageing composer of traditional Cantonese music. His harried later years are a reflection of the political vicissitudes of New China. Mandarin and Cantonese dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Susso kids
results.brief_description: Crops might just as well be ploughed into the ground or left to rot in the sun! From Black Thursday, October 1929, Australian productivity had never been higher, but there was no market for it. This documentary depicts causes and effects of the Great Depression in Australia, using film clips of the period. Shows the divisive effect of the disparity in living conditions, attempts by the unemployed to improve their social and economic circumstances and the plight of the children. Linked by songs of the period. Commentary by Telford Jackson.

results.title: Suspects all
results.creator_credit: Anthony Pelissier, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatised fatal factory fire and its investigation shows how such accidents can result from carelessness, fire hazards such as litter, poor building design, overloaded electrical circuits and lack of fire drill for the staff.

results.title: Surviving the Outback Rivers
results.brief_description: The vast Australian Outback has been described as a land of heroes and dead men. Join Scott Lambert and seven Australian army commandoes who are all recipients of the green beret on a three week rafting expedition, where enough provisions for one week have been taken, with the idea of “living off the land” for most of the time. Setting out from Darwin, the journey will take these adventurers down the Katherine River through the Katherine Gorge, then back through the Clarevale Crossing and the Daly River Crossing, back to Darwin. A fascinating adventure amongst some of the most beautiful wilderness in Australia.

results.title: Surviving sexual assault
results.creator_credit: Heather Williams, Ross Hutchens, West-Ed Media and Western Australia. Dept. of Health. Video Production Unit
results.brief_description: A sexual assault counsellor debunks myths about rape describing women’s responses and both short and long term effects. Explores the diverse reactions of women who have been sexually abused or assaulted through vox pops, professional advice, interviews and non-exploitative reconstructions. Outlines the healing process and support for the victim and those close to her. Accompanied by a 24p. booklet for partners, friends, family members or professional workers.

results.title: Survival swimming. - [Rev. ed.]
results.brief_description: Children and adults are seen enjoying themselves in, and on, water, and two survival situations are depicted. Demonstrates treading water, endurance swimming (suitable strokes), surface diving, swimming under water, entry into water, exit and use of rope ladder. Designed to encourage swimmers to learn how to survive in emergency situations. Revised edition of Title Code 010476.
